body_html:
From the abi:cxx11 tag in your error message, this is likely your protobuf was built with the gcc4 abi while your compiler by default uses cxx11 (aka gcc5) abi.
It's better to align the abi in your protobuf installation with your compiler. As a shortcut, add -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0" to your cmake command might solve the issue (but will run into similar issues if there are other system libs are compiled with cxx11 abi).
body_text:
From the abi:cxx11 tag in your error message, this is likely your protobuf was built with the gcc4 abi while your compiler by default uses cxx11 (aka gcc5) abi.
It's better to align the abi in your protobuf installation with your compiler. As a shortcut, add -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0" to your cmake command might solve the issue (but will run into similar issues if there are other system libs are compiled with cxx11 abi).
body:
From the `abi:cxx11` tag in your error message, this is likely your protobuf was built with the gcc4 abi while your compiler by default uses cxx11 (aka gcc5) abi.
It's better to align the abi in your protobuf installation with your compiler. As a shortcut, add `-DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0"` to your cmake command might solve the issue (but will run into similar issues if there are other system libs are compiled with cxx11 abi).
